verses.verse: He that is wounded in the stones <WH6481>, or hath his privy member <WH8212> cut off <WH3772>, shall not enter <WH935> into the assembly <WH6951> of Jehovah <WH3068>.

A bastard <WH4464> shall not enter <WH935> into the assembly <WH6951> of Jehovah <WH3068>; even to the tenth <WH6224> generation <WH1755> shall none of his enter <WH935> into the assembly <WH6951> of Jehovah <WH3068>.

An Ammonite <WH5984> or a Moabite <WH4125> shall not enter <WH935> into the assembly <WH6951> of Jehovah <WH3068>; even to the tenth <WH6224> generation <WH1755> shall none belonging to them enter <WH935> into the assembly <WH6951> of Jehovah <WH3068> for <WH5704> ever <WH5769>:

because <WH1697> they met <WH6923> you not with bread <WH3899> and with water <WH4325> in the way <WH1870>, when ye came forth <WH3318> out of Egypt <WH4714>, and because they hired <WH7936> against thee Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> from Pethor <WH6604> of Mesopotamia <WH763>, to curse thee <WH7043>.

Nevertheless Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> would <WH14> not hearken <WH8085> unto Balaam <WH1109>; but Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> turned <WH2015> the curse <WH7045> into a blessing <WH1293> unto thee <WH3068>, because Jehovah thy God <WH430> loved thee <WH157>.
Thou shalt not seek <WH1875> their peace <WH7965> nor their prosperity <WH2896> all thy days <WH3117> for ever <WH5769>.
Thou shalt not abhor <WH8581> an Edomite <WH130>; for he is thy brother <WH251>: thou shalt not abhor <WH8581> an Egyptian <WH4713>, because thou wast a sojourner <WH1616> in his land <WH776>.
The children <WH1121> of the third <WH7992> generation <WH1755> that are born <WH3205> unto them shall enter <WH935> into the assembly <WH6951> of Jehovah <WH3068>.
When thou goest forth <WH3318> in camp <WH4264> against thine enemies <WH341>, then thou shalt keep <WH8104> thee from every evil <WH7451> thing <WH1697>.

If there be among you any man <WH376>, that is not clean <WH2889> by reason of that which chanceth <WH7137> him by night <WH3915>, then shall he go <WH3318> abroad <WH2351> out of the camp <WH4264>, he shall not come <WH935> within <WH8432> the camp <WH4264>:

but it shall be <WH6153>, when evening cometh on <WH6437>, he shall bathe <WH7364> himself in water <WH4325>; and when the sun <WH8121> is down <WH935>, he shall come <WH935> within <WH8432> the camp <WH4264>.
Thou shalt have a place also <WH3027> without <WH2351> the camp <WH4264>, whither thou shalt go forth <WH3318> abroad <WH2351>:

and thou shalt have a paddle <WH3489> among thy weapons <WH240>; and it shall be <WH3427>, when thou sittest down abroad <WH2351>, thou shalt dig <WH2658> therewith <WH7725>, and shalt turn back and cover <WH3680> that which cometh from thee <WH6627>:

for Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> walketh <WH1980> in the midst <WH7130> of thy camp <WH4264>, to deliver <WH5337> thee <WH5414>, and to give up thine enemies <WH341> before <WH6440> thee <WH4264>; therefore shall thy camp be holy <WH6918>, that he may not see <WH7200> an unclean <WH6172> thing <WH1697> in thee <WH7725>, and turn away from thee <WH310>.
Thou shalt not deliver <WH5462> unto his master <WH113> a servant <WH5650> that is escaped <WH5337> from his master unto thee <WH113>:

he shall dwell <WH3427> with thee <WH7130>, in the midst of thee <WH4725>, in the place which he shall choose <WH977> within one <WH259> of thy gates <WH8179>, where it pleaseth him best <WH2896>: thou shalt not oppress him <WH3238>.
There shall be no prostitute <WH6948> of the daughters <WH1323> of Israel <WH3478>, neither shall there be a sodomite <WH6945> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>.

Thou shalt not bring <WH935> the hire <WH868> of a harlot <WH2181>, or the wages <WH4242> of a dog <WH3611>, into the house <WH1004> of Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> for any vow <WH5088>: for even both <WH8147> these are an abomination <WH8441> unto Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430>.

Thou shalt not lend upon interest <WH5391> to thy brother <WH251>; interest <WH5391> of money <WH3701>, interest <WH5392> of victuals <WH400>, interest <WH5392> of anything <WH1697> that is lent upon interest <WH5391>:

unto a foreigner <WH5237> thou mayest lend upon interest <WH5391>; but unto thy brother <WH251> thou shalt not lend upon interest <WH5391>, that Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> may bless <WH1288> thee in all that thou puttest <WH4916> thy hand <WH3027> unto <WH776>, in the land whither thou goest <WH935> in to possess it <WH3423>.

When thou shalt vow <WH5087> a vow <WH5088> unto Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430>, thou shalt not be slack <WH309> to pay <WH7999> it <WH3068>: for Jehovah thy God <WH430> will surely <WH1875> require <WH1875> it of thee <WH2399>; and it would be sin in thee.
But if thou shalt forbear <WH2308> to vow <WH5087>, it shall be no sin in thee <WH2399>.

That which is gone out <WH4161> of thy lips <WH8193> thou shalt observe <WH8104> and do <WH6213>; according as thou hast vowed <WH5087> unto Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430>, a freewill-offering <WH5071>, which thou hast promised <WH1696> with thy mouth <WH6310>.

When thou comest <WH935> into thy neighbor <WH7453>'s vineyard <WH3754>, then thou mayest eat <WH398> of grapes <WH6025> thy fill <WH7648> at thine own pleasure <WH5315>; but thou shalt not put <WH5414> any in thy vessel <WH3627>.

When thou comest <WH935> into thy neighbor <WH7453>'s standing grain <WH7054>, then thou mayest pluck <WH6998> the ears <WH4425> with thy hand <WH3027>; but thou shalt not move <WH5130> a sickle <WH2770> unto thy neighbor <WH7453>'s standing grain <WH7054>.
